Commanding upwards of $7 billion Canadian  annually, 
The UnionÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s  roots  stretch  far  and wide, directly

-Why is marijuana illegal?  
-What health risks do we really face?  
-Does prohabition work? 
-What would happen if we taxed it?
-Medicine, paper, fuel, textiles, food, etc. 

Are we missing something here?

Follow  filmmaker  Adam  Scorgie  as  he  dives  
head  first  into  Canada's  most socially  
acceptable  illegal  activity.  Along  the  way,  
Adam  demsytifies  the underground  market  and  
brings  to  light  how  such  a  large  industry

including  growers,  clippers,  police  officers,

Scorgie explores the cause and effect nature of the

Scorgie  as  he  unravels  the mystery  of  The Union.

The basic point of this documentary is to present 
the facts about Marijuana. It focuses less on the 
BC market and more on the reasons why marijuana 
should be viewed in the same light as alcohol and 
tobacco. It argues for the legalization of 
marijuana. The argument is compelling and factual 
with many legititamate sources.
